apache.conf.parser

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • apache.conf.parser.Parser
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectiveParser, EnclosureParser

    public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to provide generic parser functionality for the Apache configuration.

    • Constructor Summary

      • isCommentMatch

        public static boolean isCommentMatch(java.lang.String line)
        Utility to check if a line matches an Apache comment.
        Parameters:
        line - the line to check for a comment.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the line is a comment.

      • isDirectiveMatch

        public static boolean isDirectiveMatch(java.lang.String line,
                       java.lang.String directiveType)
        Utility to check if a line matches a directive type.
        Parameters:
        line - the line to check for the directive type.
        directiveType - the type of the directive to match against. This is not case sensitive.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the line mathes the directiveType

      • isVHostMatch

        public static boolean isVHostMatch(java.lang.String line)
        Utility used to check if a line matches a VirtualHost

        Example :
        <VirtualHost *:80>
        Parameters:
        line - the line to match against
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the line matches a VirtualHost

      • isEnclosureTypeMatch

        public static boolean isEnclosureTypeMatch(java.lang.String line,
                           java.lang.String enclosureType)
        Utility used to check if a line matches an enclosure with a specified type.
        Parameters:
        line - the line to match against the enclosure.
        enclosureType - the name of the enclosure to match against. This is not case sensitive.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the line matches the enclosure.

      • isCloseEnclosureTypeMatch

        Utility used to check if a line matches a closing enclosure with a specified type.
        Parameters:
        line - the line to match against the closing enclosure.
        enclosureType - the name of the enclosure to match against. This is not case sensitive.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the line matches the closing enclosure type.

      • isInNegateModules

        public static boolean isInNegateModules(java.lang.String line,
                        Module[] modules)
        Checks if a line has a valid ifmodule that does not belong to a loaded apache module

        Example:
        <IfModule !mpm_winnt_module> or <IfModule !mod_ssl.c>
        Parameters:
        line - the line to match against
        modules - list of modules to compare against
        Returns:
        true if the line matches a negate module

      • isInModules

        public static boolean isInModules(java.lang.String line,
                  Module[] modules)
        Checks if a line has a valid ifmodule that belongs to a loaded apache module

        Example:
        <IfModule mpm_winnt_module> or <IfModule mod_ssl.c>
        Parameters:
        line - the line to match against
        modules - list of modules to compare against
        Returns:
        true if the line matches module

      • getConfigurationParsableLines

        public ParsableLine[] getConfigurationParsableLines(boolean includeVHosts)
                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                    java.lang.Exception
        Gets a list of all parsable lines in the configuration. The lines will be included in the order that they appear in the Apache configuration.
        Parameters:
        includeVHosts - boolean indicating whether to include parsable lines in Virtual Hosts
        Returns:
        a list of parsable lines
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • getFileParsableLines

        public ParsableLine[] getFileParsableLines(java.lang.String file,
                                  boolean includeVHosts)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           java.lang.Exception
        Gets a list of all parsable lines in a file. The lines will be included in the order that they appear in the Apache configuration.
        Parameters:
        includeVHosts - boolean indicating whether to include parsable lines in Virtual Hosts
        Returns:
        a list of parsable lines
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • getActiveConfFileList

        public java.lang.String[] getActiveConfFileList()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets a unique list of configuration files currently included in the apache configuration.
        Returns:
        an array with all included configuration files. The list of files is in the order that they appear in the apache configuration.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
